name: UptimeCheckServiceClient
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
UptimeCheckServiceClient
description: The UptimeCheckService API is used to manage (list, create, delete, edit) uptime check configurations in the Stackdriver Monitoring product. An uptime check is a piece of configuration that determines which resources and services to monitor for availability. These configurations can also be configured interactively by navigating to the [Cloud Console] (http://console.cloud.google.com), selecting the appropriate project, clicking on “Monitoring” on the left-hand side to navigate to Stackdriver, and then clicking on “Uptime”.

methods.name: project_path
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
UptimeCheckServiceClient.project_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: uptime_check_config_path
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
UptimeCheckServiceClient.uptime_check_config_path
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified uptime_check_config resource name string.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Provides the means for authenticating requests made by the client. This parameter can be many types. A Google::Auth::Credentials uses a the properties of its represented keyfile for authenticating requests made by this client. A String will be treated as the path to the keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A Hash will be treated as the contents of a keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A GRPC::Core::Channel will be used to make calls through. A GRPC::Core::ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client. The channel credentials should already be composed with a GRPC::Core::CallCredentials object. A Proc will be used as an updater_proc for the Grpc channel. The proc transforms the metadata for requests, generally, to give OAuth credentials.

params.name: scopes
params.description:
The OAuth scopes for this service. This parameter is ignored if
an updater_proc is supplied.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

methods.name: list_uptime_check_configs
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
UptimeCheckServiceClient#list_uptime_check_configs
methods.description: Lists the existing valid uptime check configurations for the project, leaving out any invalid configurations.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3"

uptime_check_service_client = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheck.new
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheckServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# Iterate over all results.
uptime_check_service_client.list_uptime_check_configs(formatted_parent).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
uptime_check_service_client.list_uptime_check_configs(formatted_parent).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: parent
params.description:
The project whose uptime check configurations are listed. The format is

+projects/[PROJECT_ID]+.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheckConfig instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

params.name: name
params.description:
The uptime check configuration to retrieve. The format is

+projects/[PROJECT_ID]/uptimeCheckConfigs/[UPTIME_CHECK_ID]+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3"

uptime_check_service_client = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheck.new
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheckServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# TODO: Initialize +uptime_check_config+:
uptime_check_config = {}
response = uptime_check_service_client.create_uptime_check_config(formatted_parent, uptime_check_config)

params.name: parent
params.description:
The project in which to create the uptime check. The format is:

+projects/[PROJECT_ID]+.

params.name: uptime_check_config
params.description: The new uptime check configuration. A hash of the same form as Google::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheckConfig can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: update_uptime_check_config
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
UptimeCheckServiceClient#update_uptime_check_config
methods.description: Updates an uptime check configuration. You can either replace the entire configuration with a new one or replace only certain fields in the current configuration by specifying the fields to be updated via +”updateMask”+. Returns the updated configuration.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3"

uptime_check_service_client = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheck.new

# TODO: Initialize +uptime_check_config+:
uptime_check_config = {}
response = uptime_check_service_client.update_uptime_check_config(uptime_check_config)

params.name: uptime_check_config
params.description: Required. If an +”updateMask”+ has been specified, this field gives the values for the set of fields mentioned in the +”updateMask”+. If an +”updateMask”+ has not been given, this uptime check configuration replaces the current configuration. If a field is mentioned in +”updateMask+” but the corresonding field is omitted in this partial uptime check configuration, it has the effect of deleting/clearing the field from the configuration on the server. A hash of the same form as Google::Monitoring::V3::UptimeCheckConfig can also be provided.

params.name: update_mask
params.description: Optional. If present, only the listed fields in the current uptime check configuration are updated with values from the new configuration. If this field is empty, then the current configuration is completely replaced with the new configuration. A hash of the same form as Google::Protobuf::FieldMask can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: delete_uptime_check_config
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
UptimeCheckServiceClient#delete_uptime_check_config
methods.description: Deletes an uptime check configuration. Note that this method will fail if the uptime check configuration is referenced by an alert policy or other dependent configs that would be rendered invalid by the deletion.

params.name: name
params.description:
The uptime check configuration to delete. The format is

+projects/[PROJECT_ID]/uptimeCheckConfigs/[UPTIME_CHECK_ID]+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.
